text: Philip Hallen Dybvig (born May 22, 1955) is an American economist. He is a professor at Washington University in St. Louis. His research focuses on asset pricing, Banking, Investments, and Corporate Governance. He was a professor at Yale University, and assistant professor at Princeton University. Dybvig is known for his work with Douglas Diamond on the Diamondâ€“Dybvig model of bank runs."Bank runs aren't madness: This model explained why" Anil K Kashyup, June 15, 2015, Retrieved on March 24, 2016. Dybvig won the 2022 Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences with Diamond and Ben Bernanke. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:American economists Category:Academics from Missouri Category:Scientists from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Educators from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Yale University faculty Category:Princeton University faculty Category:Scientists from Florida Category:Academics from Florida Category:People from Gainesville, Florida
title: Philip H. Dybvig
